contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox hiking trail |name=GR20 |photo=GR 20 map.png |caption=Map of Corsica showing the route of the '''GR 20''' |location=[[Corsica]] |designation=[[GR footpath]] |length_km=180 |trailheads=[[Calenzana]], [[Conca, Corse-du-Sud|Conca]] |use=Hiking |elev_change= |highest= |lowest= |difficulty= |season= |months= |sights= |hazards=Fog, High winds }} [[Image:GR20 Usciolu-Asinao.jpg|thumb|right|Red and white marks and sometimes piles of rocks indicate the direction.]] The '''GR 20''' (or ''fra li monti'') is a [[GR footpath]] that crosses the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]] [[island]] of [[Corsica]] running approximately north-south, described by the outdoor writer Paddy Dillon as "one of the top trails in the world".<ref>Paddy Dillon, GR20 - Corsica: The High Level Route. '''Cicerone'''</ref> {| align=left |[[Image:GareVizzavona.jpg|thumb|left|The railway station in Vizzavona.]] |- |[[Image:Gr20.jpg|thumb|left|A hiking boot, found just before the last ''refuge'' before arriving at Conca - the southern end of the trail.]] |} The whole trail is about 180 km long, clearly waymarked throughout, the walk for most people takes around 15 days. The trail is usually considered as two parts: the northern part, between [[Calenzana]] and [[Vizzavona]] and the southern part, between [[Vizzavona]] and [[Conca, Corse-du-Sud|Conca]]. Vizzavona is considered the middle as there is a train station, and therefore is an accessible point for walkers beginning or ending a walk consisting of half the route. From Vizzavona, the train can be taken to [[Bastia]] or [[Ajaccio]] as well as many smaller towns and villages such as [[Corte]]. The northern part is considered by some the more difficult part, because of the steep and rocky paths, though this could be an effect of many walkers beginning in the north and not being as fit for this section. The southern part of the trail is often considered easier though the lower altitude may give rise to higher temperatures in summer and so provide more difficult walking conditions. Along the trail there are mountain huts described as "''refuges''" or [[gîte]]s. The standard and price of accommodations and food varies from refuge to refuge. One can sleep in a tent near the refuge, but it is not permitted to pitch tents along the trail. The GR 20 is an advanced trail. Of the less difficult but beautiful trails on the island two [[Mare e monti]] (from sea to mountain) and three [[Mare a mare]] (from sea to sea) trails are the best known. ==Route== * Northern part: [[Calenzana]] - Ortu di Piobbu or Bonifatu (alternative route) - Carozzu - Asco Stagnu - Tighjettu - Ciottulu di I Mori (or Castel de Vergio) - Manganu - Petra Piana - L'Onda - [[Vizzavona]] * Southern part: [[Vizzavona]] - E Capenelle - I Prati - Usciulu - Matalza (added in the late 2011) - Asinao - I Paliri - [[Conca, Corse-du-Sud|Conca]] ==See also== * [[Orla Perć]] ==Citations== <references/> ==External links== * [http://www.gr20.be www.gr20.be] *[http://www.parc-corse.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=105&Itemid=175 GR 20 on the official website of the Parc naturel régional de Corse] (in French) *[http://corsica.forhikers.com/gr20 GR 20 route planning] - comprehensive information for hikers, maps, GPS files, photos and a very *Informative video (on the northern section of the GR 20): [http://www.vimeo.com/15061401 Memories of a Trekker] *Another Informative video (on the southern section of the GR 20): [http://www.vimeo.com/29148378 Memories of a Trekker 2 - Return to the Island] *[http://gr20corsica.wordpress.com/about/ The quick and dirty facts] *[http://www.mylinea.com/cguelfucci/randonnee_en_corse/carnets_de_voyage/ An index (in French) of the multiple personal pages relating a trek along GR 20] *[http://www.viaggicugini.it/manualeGR20.php An index (in Italian) of the handbook for a trek "GR 20"] {{coord missing|France}} [[Category:Corsica]] [[Category:Hiking trails in France]] [[Category:Visitor attractions in Corsica]]
